## Vertical Planar Motion Mechanism Tender
### Request for Proposal
#### Solicitation Number: 23-58041/A
#### Reference Number: CB-218-80199976
#### Amendment Number: 10
#### Amendment Date: February 6, 2024

The National Research Council of Canada (NRC) is soliciting proposals for the procurement of a Vertical Planar Motion Mechanism (VPMM) to support hydrodynamic research in the 200m long tow tank at the Ocean, Coastal, and River Engineering (OCRE) research center in St. John's, Newfoundland and Labrador.

### Contract Requirements
The proposed contract is open to international trade agreements and will be awarded for a period of 16 months following contract award. Deliveries are required to the OCRE research center in St. John's, NL.

### Key Details
* **Delivery Date:** The VPMM must be delivered on or before 12 months after contract award.
* **Security Level:** The successful contractor must meet a minimum security level of "Reliability."
* **Point of Contact:** Paul Hewitt, Contracting Authority, can be reached at 343-573-1068 or [Paul.Hewitt@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca](mailto:Paul.Hewitt@nrc-cnrc.gc.ca).
* **Trade Agreements:** This contract is subject to all Canadian international trade agreements.

### Tender Documents
The following documents are attached to this tender notice:
* Solicitation notice (English and French)
* Request for Proposal (English and French)
* Statement of Work (English and French)
* Amendment 001-10
* 3D Model of the VPMM
* Amendment 5

Note: All attached documents are available for download from the Canada Buys website at [https://canadabuys.canada.ca](https://canadabuys.canada.ca).

### Tender Submission
Proposals must be submitted electronically via the Canada Buys platform by the closing date and time of February 6, 2024, at 14:00 ET. Late submissions will not be accepted.

### Contact Information
For any questions or clarifications, please contact Paul Hewitt at the above email or phone number. I hope this revised version meets your requirements. I made sure to keep the essential information while reformatting the text in a more professional manner. Let me know if you need further assistance. I can also provide a longer or more detailed response if you need. -[Your Name]---your
